pr_title: NMS-12521: Use protobuf instead of bson for Netflow

timeline.bodyText: BMP? :)
timeline.author: j-white
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,67 @@

+
+import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;

+import org.opennms.core.ipc.sink.api.AsyncDispatcher;
+import org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.api.receiver.TelemetryMessage;

+
+import com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry;

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure if this will work out well. In sflow it's still possible to return multiple flows from one incoming message.
Collections.singletonList should make it easy to implement the original interface.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Should be Optional.ofNullable.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Should be Optional.ofNullable
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: SmaplingAlgorithm is an enum by itself. We should use the enum variants instead of the number.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Should be Optional.ofNullable
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Use the variants here, too.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure if "" is semantically equal to null in this case.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: VLAN 0 is not equal to no VLAN
timeline.author: fooker

replies.bodyText: yeah, proto has primitives and never returns null  even for Strings.  need to find a way to differentiate between actual values and not having a value.
replies.author: cgorantla

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer to have these messages in the parser and keep the proto implementations clean of that knowledge.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer to have these messages in the parser and keep the proto implementations clean of that knowledge.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Any reason to remove these finals?
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: This can implement the Converter interface and can be used instead of the {Netflow 5, Netflow9, IPFIX} specific converter implementations. And Therefore it should be renamed, too.
timeline.author: fooker
timeline.diffHunk:

timeline.bodyText: Organize your imports :)
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can add a generic NetflowAdapter which reduces the duplicated code in all adapters (which will be all the same, if we unify the Converters). The old Adapter implementations should kept for backward compatibility but will reduce to empty sub-classes.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Same as for IpfixAdapter.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Same as for IpfixAdapter.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Same as for IpfixConverter.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Same as for IpfixConverter.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: This can will be obsolete if FlowMapper will implement Converter
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText:
Can we move the FlowMessageBuilder implementations to the parser module and let the parser do the dispatch by an abstract method (something like protected abstract FlowMessageProtoOrBuilder buildMessage(record, enrichment).
In addition, there are a couple of methods below, which still do BSON stuff. Are the still needed?
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: This dispatching should be done in the parsers...
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Is this really required? The simple no-op RecordEnrichement implementation can be moved to the tests and the original method can be called instead.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure about this one. I would prefer to use the Values visitor instead of instanceof.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this should return Optional instead of a hard coded default.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: This would benefit from Optionals, too.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: I can't see any usage - do I miss something?
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this should be called makeTypeValue or buildTypeValue.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText:
I think this can be simplified by assuming that there will be only one value for each of these "duplicates" which we try to resolve with the first(...) calls below.
As an example:
Intant flowEnd should be just. You can set it for all its variants (flowEndSeconds, flowEndMilliseconds, flowEndMicroseconds, ...) and just overwrite it if it really should occur more than once.
This would reduce the complexity to just the handling of the absolute and the delta values.
This is true for a couple of other fields, too.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Things like this would simplify if getTypeValue would return an Optional.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Don't use isPresent. This can be done by nested firsts and single ifPresent which will set the value.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Oh man, this thing is quite a mess - but I don't have any idea on how to make it any better.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Please do not commit stuff like this - makes review more hard...
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Do not commit stuff like this, please.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: I can't find any usage of this - is it still needed?
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText:
This should be moved to a standalone class.
The old *Flow (like IpfixFlow) classes can be removed.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: I can see this is useful during the transition but I would prefer to get rid of the BSON stuff completely. My proposal is to generate the BSON output one last time and use it to generate some JSON which will be used in this tests instead.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: What's the difference?
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText: Just make the method throws Exception.
timeline.author: fooker

replies.bodyText: Right. But in the end it could be a good old for loop, right?
replies.author: fooker

replies.bodyText: Since packet.getRecords() is a stream, I'm inclined to keep this way.
replies.author: cgorantla

timeline.bodyText: Same here
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.message:
NMS-12521: Move from bson to proto for netflow

NMS-12521: Some more refactoring

NMS-12521: Fix integration tests and may be smoke as well
